abstract: It's been 25 years since the photographer Bruce Davidson wowed the world with his own "Subway" series.
snippet: It's been 25 years since the photographer Bruce Davidson wowed the world with his own "Subway" series.
lead_paragraph: In 1980, the photographer Bruce Davidson went underground and began snapping away at the young, the old, the Latinos, the Hasids, the black, the white, the angry, the lonely and the aimless, who were all bundled together and jostled around on the New York City subway. "[It] was in a deplorable state of disrepair," Davidson, now 78, told The Moment. "Graffiti scrabbled on doors and windows and a dangerous atmosphere persisted. There was something in the air at that time that drove me into the dark tunnels of the subway."
